value.description: More than 80 years after his death, it perfectly explains not just the SNP’s appallingly politicised behaviour during the Covid crisis, but their entire way of working. Freud’s theory was based on observing neighbouring communities. These communities ...

value.name: What is the legal definition of genocide?
value.description: According to the Genocide Convention, the definition of genocide is any of the following acts committed with intent to destroy, in whole or in part, a national, ethnical, racial or religious group. This includes: Deliberately inflicting on the group conditions of life calculated to bring about its physical destruction in whole or in part

value.name: Wishaw MP heaps further pressure on UK Government over Post Office scandal
value.description: Marion Fellows accused ministers of scapegoating chairman Henry Staunton - amid the fallout from the ITV drama, Mr Bates v the Post Office - to deflect from its own role.

value.name: Sturgeon told evidence did not support Covid school closures day before she shut them, inquiry hears
value.description: Ministers were warned in March 2020 that stopping classes could actually increase risks of pandemic, cabinet records show

value.name: The misogyny Nicola Sturgeon has had to endure is shameful
value.description: That we never properly understand something until it’s considered in hindsight, has rarely been more evident than with the misogyny, in all

value.name: MPs queue up to demand separation of ‘Sheikh and state’ in Telegraph sale
value.description: An urgent question on the sale of The Telegraph had been granted to the Conservative backbencher Alicia Kearns, the chairman of the Foreign Affairs Select Committee and an avowed opponent of RedBird IMI’s plans. She demanded a national security review as “we cannot separate Sheikh and state”.

value.name: Nicola Sturgeon 'ranted' at Humza Yousaf in stormy Cabinet meeting over covid support
value.description: Nicola Sturgeon began "ranting" at Humza Yousaf at a stormy Scottish Government meeting during the coronavirus pandemic, the UK Covid Inquiry has heard. In a text message exchange with Jason Leitch from December 2021, the now First Minister said he took "a hell of a bullet" from his old boss.

value.name: Matheson facing calls to quit over ‘deadly disarray’ in A&E departments
value.description: Michael Matheson is facing fresh calls to quit as Health Secretary as figures show more than a third of patients in accident and emergency had to wait longer than the target time for care. The latest waiting time figures for the week ending January 21 show 62 per cent of patients were either admitted, transferred or discharged within four hours.

value.name: Parties pick candidates for by election in Glasgow in March
value.description: Candidates have been chosen to fight the Hillhead by-election in Glasgow. The four parties represented on the council have selected who will contest the vote on March 7. The by-election was called after the death of long-serving Labour councillor, Hanzala Malik, in December, last year.

value.name: How Integrated Programs Can Address The Challenges Of Limited English Proficiency For Dual Eligible Individuals
value.description: State policy makers can improve person-centered care for dual-eligible individuals with limited English proficiency and their caregivers using tools such as the Medicare Advantage dual-eligible special needs plan (D-SNP), state Medicaid agency contract ...
